messages.author: nduca
messages.text: How does the Macosx SetSwapBuffersCallback get implemented? It seems that's done without touching the main Gl context?

messages.author: Ken Russell
messages.text:
On 2010/11/23 16:59:49, nduca wrote:
> How does the Macosx SetSwapBuffersCallback get implemented? It seems that's done
> without touching the main Gl context?

It's wired up through the GLES2Decoder. It does seem that that would be an alternative; the callback could be called from DoResizeCHROMIUM before calling GLContext::SetSize(), and would avoid changes to the GLContext.

messages.author: jonathan.backer
messages.text:
On 2010/11/23 19:17:55, kbr wrote:
> On 2010/11/23 16:59:49, nduca wrote:
> > How does the Macosx SetSwapBuffersCallback get implemented? It seems that's
> done
> > without touching the main Gl context?
> 
> It's wired up through the GLES2Decoder. It does seem that that would be an
> alternative; the callback could be called from DoResizeCHROMIUM before calling
> GLContext::SetSize(), and would avoid changes to the GLContext.

Done.

messages.author: jonathan.backer
messages.text:
On 2010/11/23 16:59:49, nduca wrote:
> same comments about in32

Done.

messages.author: nduca
messages.text: jam@ has been pushing me to use ints instead of int32s in this file. I've changed the rest of the file in my cl, but might be good to keept his addition consistent with that [yet-to-be-landed change]

messages.author: jonathan.backer
messages.text:
On 2010/11/23 16:59:49, nduca wrote:
> jam@ has been pushing me to use ints instead of int32s in this file. I've
> changed the rest of the file in my cl, but might be good to keept his addition
> consistent with that [yet-to-be-landed change]

Done. I'm switching to gfx::Size because it is more consistent with some of the other messages in gpu_messages_internal.h

messages.author: jonathan.backer
messages.text:
On 2010/11/23 19:17:55, kbr wrote:
> with -> will

Done.

messages.author: nduca
messages.text: Suggeset calling this didAcceleratedCompositingActivated to be consistent with the naming. In issue 4815001, I've renamed this function to OnMsgAcceleratedCompositingActivated [I think, I might have the name slightly wrong...]

messages.text:

messages.author: nduca
messages.text: Is there a way to put this callback on the GL-specific implementation? Its a bit awkward to have this on the global GL context.

messages.author: jonathan.backer
messages.text:
On 2010/11/23 16:59:49, nduca wrote:
> Is there a way to put this callback on the GL-specific implementation? Its a bit
> awkward to have this on the global GL context.

Done.

message: Moved IPC call up to GpuCommandBufferStub via callback to satisfy checkdeps.
